In Julia, Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
using Distributed, Threads

function pig_latinify(str)
    # Split word into head and tail
    head = str[1]
    tail = str[2:end]

    # If word starts with a vowel, append "way" to end
    if head in ["A", "E", "I", "O", "U", "a", "e", "i", "o", "u"]
        return str * "way"
    else
        # Otherwise, move head to end and append "ay"
        return tail * head * "ay"
    end
end

# Test the pig_latinify function
strings = ["apple", "banana", "cherry", "dog", "elephant"]

# Convert strings to pig latin using multithreading
pig_latin_strings = threads(@parallelmap(x -> pig_latinify(x), strings))

# Print the pig latin strings
println(pig_latin_strings)
```
